Vint Cerf said Eric Schmidt , 55, had been chief executive for 10 years-`` a nice round number''- and Page, now 37, was ready to lead the company into the future. Larry and Sergey Brin are 10 years older than they were when they thoughtfully hired Eric Schmidt to be the CEO... so everybody's growing up, Vint Cerf said.`` He was the only guy that stood up to them- these were two young, smart, incredibly brilliant guys who literally had just dropped their PhDs to go start this company.

Sergey Brin 's world-changing creation, thrusts Eric Schmidt into a role where he won't see the Googleplex very often. In ceding control of day-to-day operations to Page, Eric Schmidt told financial analysts that he's preparing to focus on the things I'm most interested in . In other words, meet Google's new schmoozer in chief. A statement from David Cameron read: I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my director of communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so.`` Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government. Andy Coulson 's position had appeared tenuous for several months as the row over phone hacking at the News of the World intensified. Allen Iverson had 26 points, nine assists, and combined with Linas Kleiza , JR Smith and Eduardo Najera on a 14-1 fourth-quarter spurt that carried the Nuggets to a 125-114 victory over the New Jersey Nets on Friday night. We've been struggling, losing two on the road and we just wanted to do anything to get a win, Allen Iverson said after scoring 21 second-half points to help the Nuggets break a two-game losing streak. The Nuggets needed every one of those points after blowing a 17-point third-quarter lead and eventually falling behind by two.`` Welcome

... It just[ felt] negative.'' The` Just Go With It' star was referring to past seasons that included the outspoken Simon Cowell at the judges' table. Oprah Winfrey defended him, saying, I'm a Simon Cowell fan and what I thought is that Simon Cowell had a way of speaking the truth that was saying what you wanted to say but you wouldn't actually say it. She added,`` I will say that it's a kinder, gentler[ show now.]''
